intro: Diascia ausana, commonly known as the scarlet glory flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Diascia ausana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower due to its long-lasting blooms.
